page.title: 20SCHOOLS 2
page.content: THE OTHER MAIN CONCERN IS THE LACK OF A SIXTH FORM AT THE HIGH SCHOOL.IF CHILDREN WISH TO CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION PASSED THE AGE OF 16 THEY ARE FACED WITH HAVING TO TRANSFER TO OTHER SCHOOLS WHICH HAVE A SIXTH FORM.THE NEAREST OF THESE IS AT WYMONDHAM. THE HIGH SCHOOL IS CONSIDERED TOO SMALL BY THE L.E.A. TO WARRENT A SIXTH FORM AND SOME PARENTS CONSIDER THIS TO BE A MAJOR DRAWBACK TO THE SCHOOL AND THUS TRANSFER TO THE PRIVATE SECTOR. THE AMOUNT OF SPENDING BY THE NORFOLK COUNTY COUNCIL HAS ALSO BECOME AN ISSUE IN THE PAST YEAR FOLLOWING THE PUBLICATION OF AN{H.M.I. REPORT}ON NORFOLK SCHOOLS.THE REPORT HIGHLIGHTED VARIOUS DEFICIENCIES ESPECIALLY IN THE AMOUNT OF CAPITATION AND IN THE DELAPIDATED STATE OF MANY OF THE COUNTIES BUILDIINGS.
